textRun.content: Product Cloud - M1.3 - Content Delivery and Download - Iter #1
M1.5 - Content Delivery and Download (M2 - Upload, Download, and Stream Content)
Prod2 Change Spec - Product: Product - Modify Product content provider
No, as this is part of a P2 Milestone 1 covering multiple products and features.
What is the business value that the milestone will deliver
This Milestone introduces the functionality for content streaming and download, integrates it with the Product and collects corresponding metrics for analytics purposes.
Technical guide on exactly what you're trying to do

Many major online REDACTED are using a combination of both REDACTED and REDACTED to reach their audience across all platforms and devices. Although effective, this also complicates their REDACTED, REDACTED and deployment workflow. REDACTED and REDACTED are looking to ease this burden with the introduction of the REDACTED (REDACTED) standard.

Where REDACTED uses the REDACTED (REDACTED) container format for packaging its media, REDACTED is almost solely used in combination with REDACTED (REDACTED). REDACTED utilising both REDACTED currently need to pay twice to REDACTED and REDACTED their content. Furthermore, these REDACTED, although representing the same REDACTED, will both be competing for REDACTED on REDACTED, reducing the overall delivery efficiency.

The REDACTED (REDACTED) was standardized by REDACTED in REDACTED and defines a REDACTED which can hold REDACTED, REDACTED or REDACTED data. Best known for its efficiency in allowing REDACTED to be simultaneously referenced by REDACTED and REDACTED, the standard also offers an additional intriguing benefit inherited from the REDACTED profile, which is REDACTED. To clarify, just using REDACTED themselves will do nothing to REDACTED. To obtain REDACTED, the REDACTED must be paired with REDACTED, REDACTED and REDACTED so that the overall system enables REDACTED.

To help simplify the REDACTED of the REDACTED, a standardized method for REDACTED has been adopted by leading REDACTED systems called REDACTED (REDACTED). REDACTED is an REDACTED standard that defines a common format for REDACTED, REDACTED, and REDACTED methods.

A primary goal of REDACTED is to allow a single REDACTED to be REDACTED only once for REDACTED across numerous REDACTED which use different REDACTED systems. The benefit is a reduction in cost and complexity of REDACTED delivery. As one example, the same REDACTED can be REDACTED for REDACTED by both REDACTED (via its REDACTED) and REDACTED (which use REDACTED).

- Prod2 Change -  Product: Product Cloud - Use AWS CloudFront
Deliver REDACTED content using Amazon CloudFront
P1 ITD 7.1 - Reuse the existing CloudFront distribution for REDACTED content
Do we want to use a separate CloudFront distribution for REDACTED content or reuse the
Use a separate CloudFront distribution for REDACTED content
Reuse the existing CloudFront distribution for REDACTED content

with multiple origin points, we can give the end consumer of the APIs the impression they are all part of the same service - for example, by using /graphql for appsync and /REDACTED for the Product REDACTED S3 bucket. We will also not have to manage multiple sets of similar settings for different distributions and create the potential for situations of setting inconsistencies, as the REDACTED content is not expected to be treated differently from other types of content in Product in terms of policies.
Using a single CloudFront web distribution to serve content from multiple origins using multiple behaviors
P1 ITD 7.2 - Rely on CloudWatch events to monitor REDACTED content usage through CloudFront, and maintain 31 days worth of CloudFront access logs
Do we want to collect CloudFront access logs to have a detailed picture of authorized and unauthorized access requests?
to monitor REDACTED content usage through CloudFront
to monitor REDACTED content usage through CloudFront, and maintain 31 days worth of CloudFront
Use S3 lifecycle policies to archive 334 more days worth of logs to AWS S3 Glacier.

Detailed information on users requests wouldnt benefit service health and security monitoring, however it is certainly beneficial to diagnose user-specific issues and emergency situations, especially right after the new REDACTED system is launched and to generate bandwidth reports of

. We can rely on CloudWatch events to paint a general picture of service health, while still maintaining a 31 day period worth of logs for diagnostics and reporting purposes with a 1 year worth of data archived in case of a more thorough diagnostics or more representative reports are needed.
P1 ITD 7.3 - Apply on the fly CENC encryption using Lambda@Edge when delivering the REDACTED for streaming with download possibility disabled
What encryption model do we want to apply to the REDACTED content we are streaming to the audience?
Storing the REDACTED files encrypted in CENC - CBC
Storing the REDACTED files encrypted in CENC - CTR
Storing the REDACTED files encrypted in both CENC - CTR and CBC variants
Apply on the fly CENC encryption using Lambda@Edge when delivering the REDACTED for streaming with download possibility disabled

Implementing no encryption for REDACTED streaming exposes a simple mechanism for downloading the REDACTED stream by the end user, even if the download option is explicitly disabled in Product, which can be utilized even by non-technical users using browser extensions. In order to obstruct the attack vector we need to encrypt the REDACTED stream. It can be done in several ways: encrypting the file itself, or doing encryption on the fly.

Encrypting the file would mean the necessity to decrypt it on streaming and download both independently on the download enabled/disabled setting. Moreover, Apple and Android devices use different flavors to CENC encryption, requiring us to store 2 variants of the file, which becomes inefficient in terms of space consumed and defiles the purpose of using CMAF in the first place.

Encrypting the stream on the fly is a better option, and allows us to only do encryption when needed. By using Lambda@Edge to perform the encryption we can take advantage of caching both encrypted and unencrypted versions of the file separately upon request.
Serving Private Content with Signed URLs and Signed Cookies
Use CloudFront signed cookies to enforce authorization of REDACTED uploads and downloads
P1 ITD 8.1 - Have the download and streaming URLs be valid for one use only
How long must the download and streaming URLs be valid?
Have the download and streaming URLs be valid for a period of time
Have the download and streaming URLs be valid for one use only
The decision is driven by the
. Theres no P1 level reason to take a different decision on the subject.
Embed the open source HTML5 REDACTED player REDACTED.js in Products UI
There are several per-tenant configurations required for Product REDACTED:
Turning on or off transcriptions / captions
Turning on or off download links

An equivalent UI to what is provided today when using Perceptive should be built to support uploads and playback when not using Perceptive. Which UI is shown will depend on the flag as mentioned in ITD-2.

Product can continue to collect usage metrics on views, comments, etc, just as it does on other types of objects.  If needed, in the future we can enhance Product to also collect REDACTED specific metrics.
P1 ITD 9.1 - Collect events used by Product for other types of content and the REDACTED playback events, including: playing, paused, buffering, ended
Which types of events are we interested in when delivering REDACTED content?
Collect events used by Product for other types of content
Collect REDACTED playback events, including: playing, paused, buffering, ended
Collect events used by Product for other types of content and the REDACTED playback events, including: playing, paused, buffering, ended

It is expected that Product REDACTED content is treated as regular Product content. Therefore we want to collect the same events that we collect for other types of Product content, which allow us to monitor content consumption. In addition to that, it is important to collect REDACTED-specific playback events for usage analytics.
REDACTED.js Event on REDACTED pausing to buffer
These demos will be evaluated according to th
REDACTEDs can be streamed and downloaded by the user
Cloud environment with no changes in scope of this P2 applied
Product Cloud environment with changes in scope of this Milestone applied
REDACTEDs can be downloaded or streamed with the ability to view captions and transcripts in different languages.
REDACTED content is delivered from Amazon CloudFront
The same CloudFront distribution is used for REDACTED delivery, which is used to deliver other Product content
REDACTED download and streaming is subject for standard Product authorization logic
CloudFront REDACTED content request authorization is performed using CloudFront signed cookies
REDACTED access (download/streaming) checks Product entitlements just like any other piece of uploaded content
Unauthorized REDACTED download and streaming requests are rejected
Download and streaming access to REDACTED files is only possible via URLs generated by Product and for a one time
REDACTED is rendered in Product UI using the REDACTED.js player
The new REDACTED playback UI as implemented in scope of this Milestone is equivalent to the one used to stream REDACTEDs uploaded before the changes (using Perceptive)
When download possibility is disabled, REDACTED stream is encrypted on the fly using CloudFront signed cookies and is delivered to the client in an
When download possibility is enabled no explicit on the fly encryption is performed over the REDACTED stream (aside from the communication protocol-related)
Desktop, Android and iOS-based devices decrypt the REDACTED stream natively, without customly developed mechanisms
CloudFront access logs collection is enabled for the CloudFront distribution
S3 bucket that is used for access log storage is configured to store last 31 days worth of logs and archive 334 more days worth of logs to AWS S3 Glacier
Product collects the same metrics for REDACTED content, as it does for different types of objects (metrics on views, comments, etc.)
Product collects metrics on REDACTED playback events: play, pause, buffering, ended
are updated to reflect the fact that Mobile Safari on iPhone and iPad for iOS are supported as of version 10 and later (instead of 8 and 9 and later as of now)
